content:
@Dan Dickey @Mike Rossiter

I'm trying to persuade my Windows system to create crash dumps when openpn crashes ( I have a version which generates a segfault when started). It's about #3052

I find my self googling around and fiddling with registry keys. But whatever I do, there just is no crash .dmp file created. Any clue?

Cleaned out OpenCPN from a W10 machine. Installed a build from about 2 days ago. Crashed when importing this one:
TradNav-v2.3.0_msvc-wx32-10-win32.tar.gz .
A crashdump.dmp file was made.
But not for me. Seems to be about registry setup. Have you done anything about it?

registry setup. Have you done anything about it?

Nothing was changed. Installed OpenCPN from a package.
I can try it tonight. Itâ€™s probably a registry/path issue.

Anyway, I have found another path. BIts and pieces are in https://github.com/OpenCPN/OpenCPN/pull/3070, tentative docs in https://opencpn-manuals.github.io/main/opencpn-dev/stacktrace.html. This way seems to avoid the registry problems.
